alert.note: Alert for Caguas; Gurabo; San Lorenzo (Puerto Rico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Juan (San Juan, Puerto Rico)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued February 06 at 5:56PM AST until February 06 at 9:00PM AST by NWS San Juan
info.description: The National Weather Service in San Juan has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Caguas in Puerto Rico... Gurabo in Puerto Rico... San Lorenzo in Puerto Rico... * Until 900 PM AST. * At 556 PM AST, USGS river gauges indicated that excessive runoff from previous rains have caused Rio Grande de Loiza to exceed flooding stage. Between 2 and 5 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in areas along the river in San Lorenzo, Caguas, and Gurabo. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. SOURCE...River gauges. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
